'''Araglas''' ({{TA|2296}}<ref>{{PM|Elendil}}, p. 196</ref> - {{TA|2455|n}},<ref name="North">{{App|North}}</ref> died aged 159) was the sixth [[Chieftain of the Dúnedain]].

==History==
Araglas was the son of Chieftain [[Aragorn I]], who was killed by wolves in {{TA|2327|n}}. Araglas' own rule was uneventful. He ruled for 128 years until he died in 2455 and was followed by his son, [[Arahad I]].<ref name="North"/>

==Etymology==
''Araglas'' is a [[Sindarin]] name. Its meaning is not glossed, but Paul Strack and David Salo suggest it means "Royal-joy" and is a compound of the prefix ''[[ara|ar(a)-]]'' ("noble", "royal", "high") and ''glass'' ("joy").<ref>{{webcite|author=Paul Strack|articleurl=https://www.eldamo.org/content/words/word-4246006207.html|articlename=S. ''Araglas'' m.|website=Eldamo|accessed=05 February 2022}}</ref><ref>{{HM|GS}}, p. 341</ref>
